The collision happened off the coast of Mexico when the boat was catapulted high into the air after it crashed into the whale. Local reports confirmed an investigation is underway to discover why the boat had not kept a safe distance from the whale.

177.title: Zareen Khan's mom admitted to ICU, actress asks fans to pray for her
177.article_body: Taking to Twitter on Tuesday, actress Zareen Khan said her mother was taken to a hospital on Monday night and added she had been admitted to the ICU. "My mom is very unwell again...Requesting all of you to please pray for my mom's speedy recovery," she tweeted. As per reports, Zareen's mother was admitted to the hospital last month too.

178.title: No one is punished for chanting Hanuman Chalisa: Sanjay Raut
178.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that no one was being punished for chanting Hanuman Chalisa. Accusing Devendra Fadnavis of misleading people on the Hanuman Chalisa issue, he said, "Trying to get inside someone else's home and destroying their peace is wrong." MP Navneet Rana and her husband were arrested after they threatened to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM's home.

179.title: Mathura unclean due to lack of sanitation mechanism: MP Hema Malini
179.article_body: Hema Malini, who is the BJP MP from UP's Mathura, said the city isn't very clean as crores of pilgrims visit it and there's a lack of mechanism for maintaining cleanliness. Malini, who was speaking at a public event in Gujarat, said, "I've tried and have been trying to change many things. Our (UP) CM Yogiji is helping a lot."

180.title: Install rainwater harvesting system or pay penalty: Indore civic body
180.article_body: The Indore Municipal Corporation has warned residents that failure to install rainwater harvesting system in buildings and commercial establishments by June 15 will invite penalties. Residential building owners can be fined up to ₹5,000 while it can go up to ₹5 Lakh for industrial units. IMC also stated that only treated water can be used for construction and vehicle washing.

181.title: BJP govt in MP couldn't even supply drinking water in 18 yrs: Cong
181.article_body: Congress on Monday criticised the BJP-led Madhya Pradesh government over its inability to provide clean drinking water despite ruling for 18 years. State Congress media department President Jitu Patwari claimed that over 10 lakh water taps were still dry. He further alleged corruption in water projects saying the government is pressurising contractors to buy pipes from three specific companies.

182.title: Cong MLA's son held for submitting fake papers to courts in rape case
182.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress MLA Murli Morwal's son Karan Morwal, who's been accused of rape, was arrested in Indore on Tuesday for submitting fake medical papers to courts. Karan forged documents while applying for anticipatory bail, claiming to have been admitted to hospital on day of alleged crime. He was previously arrested in case in October 2021 but released on bail.

183.title: 20 booked for attacking woman Sub-Inspector, constable in UP
183.article_body: Twenty people have been booked for attacking a woman Sub-Inspector and a constable when they were enquiring about a dispute in a village in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Tuesday. Superintendent of Police Prashant Verma said that on Monday SI Hemlata and constable Naresh had gone to Devin Tola in the Saraimira area when they were attacked by the locals.

184.title: Russian court orders seizure of Google's assets worth $7 mn: Report
184.article_body: A Russian court has ordered the seizure of 500 million roubles ($6.67 million) worth of Google's property and funds in Russia in connection with Google's restrictions on a Russian firm's YouTube channel, Reuters reported citing news agencies. The case concerns GPM Entertainment Television. News agency RIA reported that the court had rejected a previous claim by GPM on April 13.

185.title: Wimbledon defend ban on Russian and Belarusian players
185.article_body: Wimbledon had "no viable alternative" but ban Russian and Belarusian players from this year's Championships under the guidance provided by the British government, Chairman of the All England Club Ian Hewitt said on Tuesday. The decision was taken due to Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine which started in February. Notably, Wimbledon became the first major tournament to take this step.

186.title: Old gold, old friends still best: Sidhu on meeting Prashant Kishor
186.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Tuesday met Prashant Kishor after he declined the offer to join the party and said that "old wine, old gold and old friends" are still the best. After declining Congress' offer, Prashant Kishor said that the party needs "leadership and collective will" to fix deep-rooted structural problems through transformational reforms.

187.title: Centre cancels foreign funding licences of NGOs CHRI, AAWW
187.article_body: The Union Home Ministry has cancelled the Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) licences of two NGOs, Commonwealth Human Rights Initiative (CHRI) and Apne Aap Women Worldwide (AAWW). The action was taken over violation of the law and diverting of funds received from abroad, officials said on Tuesday. Notably, the FCRA licence is needed to receive funds from abroad.

188.title: Cong panel recommends removal of KV Thomas from all his posts
188.article_body: Congress' disciplinary committee on Tuesday recommended the removal of veteran party leader KV Thomas from all party posts. The move comes weeks after Thomas and fellow party leader Sunil Jakhar were issued show-cause notices for alleged anti-party activities. Thomas was served the notice after he attended a CPI(M) event in Kerala's Kannur earlier this month despite Congress' disapproval.

189.title: Govt does not belong to RSS or VHP: BJP MLC to Pramod Muthalik
189.article_body: BJP MLC and senior leader AH Vishwanath condemned Sri Rama Sene chief Pramod Muthalik for raking up communally sensitive issues in Karnataka. Adding that the government does not belong to the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) or the Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP), he questioned, "Who is Muthalik to dictate terms to the government and issue communally sensitive statements?"

190.title: Pair of Nike's NFT sneakers that can be worn in metaverse sell for ₹1 crore
190.article_body: A pair of Nike's NFT sneakers, equipped with rare skins, that can be worn in metaverse was sold for over ₹1 crore (45 Ether). Nike recently launched a collection of 20,000 NFT sneakers, along with RTFKT. The sneakers are selling for 2.5 to 3 Ether. The sneakers' appearances can be changed with digital vials, worth at least 0.8 Ether.

191.title: Guj MLA Mevani sent to 5-day police custody in policewoman assault case
191.article_body: An Assam Court has sent Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani to five-day police custody after he was re-arrested for allegedly assaulting a policewoman. Mevani was initially arrested over allegedly objectionable tweets about PM Narendra Modi and was granted bail on Monday. His lawyer said the second arrest took place less than 30 minutes after he got bail in the first case.

192.title: How has Virat Kohli performed in IPL as an opener?
192.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis announced that Virat Kohli will open against RR today. Kohli has opened the innings for RCB in IPL 76 times. He has scored 2,750 runs as an opener at an average of 43.65 and a strike rate of 136.67. Notably, Kohli has scored each of his five hundreds in IPL while opening.

193.title: World faces largest commodity shock since 1970s: World Bank amid Ukraine war
193.article_body: The World Bank amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war said, "The surging trade restrictions on food, fuel, and fertilisers are aggravating the largest commodity shock we've experienced since the 1970s." The "Major shock" at commodity markets "will keep prices at historically high levels through the end of 2024," said Indermit Gill, VP of Equitable Growth, Finance & Institutions at World Bank.

194.title: Novak Djokovic free to play Wimbledon as COVID-19 vaccination not mandatory
194.article_body: World number one Novak Djokovic, who was not allowed to compete at Australian Open due to being unvaccinated against COVID-19, can compete at Wimbledon as COVID-19 vaccination is not mandatory for the athletes. All England Club chief executive Sally Bolton said that it is encouraged that all players get vaccinated, but it won't be a condition of entry to compete.

195.title: Dog almost took Akshay's eye off during a scene in 'Waqt...': Director
195.article_body: Filmmaker Vipul Shah recalled the dog chase sequence from his 2005 film 'Waqt: The Race Against Time' and said they tied meat on actor Akshay Kumar's back so that the dogs would chase him. "In the last shot of that scene...one dog almost took Akshay's eye off...He simply moved his paw. Thankfully, Akshay has excellent reflexes," he added.

196.title: 99 arrested in 2 months in anti-drug crackdown: Tripura CM
196.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb said that 99 people were arrested under various Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act cases registered in January and February. He tweeted a table comparing the seizure of contraband items by BJP and that under the previous government, CPM, in Tripura. The BJP-led government assumed office in Tripura in March, 2018.

197.title: Footage showing Alec Baldwin practising with gun on 'Rust' set released
197.article_body: Police have released footage showing Alec Baldwin practising drawing a gun in costume on the sets of 'Rust' which later led to cinematographer Halyna Hutchkins' death. As per reports, it is unclear if the footage released is the moment when Halyna was killed. In the ongoing investigation, Alec had earlier claimed that he never pulled the trigger on the sets.

198.title: Secret to my performance professionalism, writers are most important: Big B
198.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, on being asked about the secret of his performance, said that it is professionalism. "Once you've signed a contract and...agreed to being a professional, then whatever is written, or whatever your director is asking you to do, you should do it," he added. The actor further said that the writer is the foremost member of the team.

199.title: CAA a narrowly tailored law, gives relaxation to specific communities: MHA
199.article_body: The Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) is a limited and narrowly tailored legislation that seeks to provide relaxation to specific communities from specified countries, said the Ministry of Home Affairs. CAA, which is yet to be implemented, aims to grant citizenship to those members of the Hindu, Sikh, Parsi and Christian communities who faced persecution in Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh.

200.title: Education officer arrested for taking bribe from a teacher in Maha
200.article_body: A woman education officer was arrested by the Anti-Corruption Bureau for taking bribe from a school teacher in Maharashtra's Palghar. The accused, Lata Sakharam Sanap, had demanded ₹50,000 from the teacher for facilitating his posting at a school in Vasai town. Later, the deal was finalised at ₹25,000, an ACB official said. The accused was caught while accepting the bribe.

201.title: US considered blasting the Moon with nuclear weapons, documents reveal
201.article_body: A now-defunct US government agency considered nuking the Moon, newly released documents have reportedly revealed. The plan reportedly suggested blasting the lunar crust and mantle with thermonuclear weapons to find 'extremely lightweight metals' below the crust. The plan was considered by Advanced Aerospace Threat Identification Program (AATIP) which wanted to build a tunnel through the Moon.

202.title: He has built a rivalry with most of us: Tsitsipas on 18-yr-old Alcaraz
202.article_body: Speaking about 18-year-old Carlos Alcaraz, world number five Stefanos Tsitsipas said building a rivalry with most of the players will help the new world number nine in future. "Don't think it can hurt him in anyway. In the beginning he was the underdog...now...he's more based, people know him better," he added. Alcaraz has won three titles so far in 2022.

203.title: Mamata Banerjee has killed democracy in WB: BJP's Tejasvi Surya
203.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya, who led BJP workers' protest rally against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday, said that Banerjee has killed democracy in the state, adding that "she has become Hitler". Surya said, "This [TMC] is a dictatorial government. We're being stripped of our right." This comes after the state police dispersed protesting BJP workers using water cannon.

204.title: Production cost of 'Bade Miyan...' to be around ₹120 cr: Report
204.article_body: The production cost of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' will reportedly be around ₹120 crore. "The production cost...will be around ₹120 crore, which is the highest-ever for an Akshay Kumar film to date," a source stated. The source added the film won't be a remake of the 1998 film as director Ali Abbas Zafar has written a new script.

205.title: Our PM, govt rescued us: Indian sailor held captive by Houthi rebels
205.article_body: Seven Indian sailors, who were recently released by the Houthi rebels in Yemen, thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for safely bringing them back to India. "The Indian government, our Prime Minister (Narendra Modi), and the Indian embassy rescued us after tough negotiations. We thank them from the bottom of our hearts," one of the rescued sailors said.

206.title: RCB to bowl first against RR, Virat Kohli to open after 2 straight golden ducks
206.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. RCB have made one change to their playing XI, with Rajat Patidar replacing Anuj Rawat. Virat Kohli will open the batting for RCB after getting out for two straight golden ducks batting at number three.

207.title: India's total COVID-19 vaccinations exceed 187.95 crore
207.article_body: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) informed that the COVID-19 vaccination coverage in India has exceeded 187.95 crore. Out of the cumulative vaccine coverage, 2,69,76,618 precaution doses have been administered to the ones eligible, informed the ministry. India began its vaccination programme on January 16, 2021.

208.title: BMC conducts health discussions, surveillance activities on World Malaria Day
208.article_body: Mumbai's civic body BMC conducted various awareness activities to combat malaria on World Malaria Day. BMC tweeted, "On the occasion of #WorldMalariaDay, outreach programs and awareness activities like poster displays, rallies, health discussions, surveillance activities and vector control activities were organised by all the departments to combat malaria." BMC plans to eradicate malaria by 2030.

209.title: These places are not just pilgrimages: PM Modi at Sivagiri event
209.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday addressed the inaugural ceremony to mark the 90th anniversary of the Sivagiri pilgrimage in Kerala and golden jubilee of Brahma Vidhyalaya. "These places are not just pilgrimages, they are not just centres of faith, they are awakened establishments of the spirit of 'Ek Bharat, Shreshtha Bharat'," PM Modi stated.

210.title: Possibility of 4th COVID wave extremely low in India: Virologist
210.article_body: Virologist and former Christian Medical College professor Dr T Jacob John said that the probability of a fourth COVID-19 wave in India is extremely low. He added that to his knowledge "no state was reporting a surge in cases." “Delhi and Haryana had minor increase in last two to three weeks but the increase is not being sustained,” he stated.

211.title: Ceasefire in Ukraine war needed immediately: UN chief in Russia
211.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres called for immediate ceasefire in Ukraine invasion at his meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov in Moscow on Tuesday. Guterres, who will next visit Ukraine, stated that conditions for effective dialogue should be created, adding he wants to reduce impact on food security due to war. He's due to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin today.

212.title: List of IPL's most valuable teams released by Forbes, MI on top
212.article_body: Forbes has released the list of IPL's most valuable teams, with five-time champions MI ranked first with a value of $1.3 billion. CSK ($1.15 billion) are second on the list, followed by KKR ($1.1 billion) and debutants LSG ($1.075 billion). DC complete the top five with $1.035-billion value. GT, who are playing their first season, are last with $850 million.

213.title: Uber faces $19 mn fine over misleading ride cancellation warnings in Aus
213.article_body: Australia's competition watchdog is suing Uber and seeking A$26 million ($19 million) in fine after the ride-sharing app admitted that it misled customers about ride fare estimates and cancellation fees. Between 2017 and 2021, Uber warned users they would be charged fees for cancelling rides even when the cancellation was sought during its 5-minute "free cancellation period", the watchdog said.

214.title: CCTV footage shows female suicide bomber blowing herself up at Karachi University
214.article_body: CCTV footage shows the moment a blast caused by a female suicide bomber ripped through a van inside the premises of the University of Karachi in Pakistan. The blast occurred in a van near the gate of the Confucius Institute. Three of those killed are reportedly Chinese nationals and Balochistan Liberation Army has claimed responsibility for the attack.

215.title: Fake kidney donation racket busted in B'luru; 3 foreigners arrested
215.article_body: Bengaluru Police have busted a fake kidney donation racket and arrested three foreign nationals in connection with it. The accused, one from Ghana and two from Nigeria, hosted fake websites and lured donors and recipients by offering up to ₹4 crore, police said. The accused created fake bank accounts but had no money in them, ACP (East) AS Rao said.

216.title: 64,827 Kashmiri Pandit families left Kashmir in 1990s due to militancy: MHA
216.article_body: Over 64,000 Kashmiri Pandit families left Kashmir valley in the early 1990s due to militancy and settled in Jammu, Delhi and other parts of the country, the government has said. According to Ministry of Home Affairs, 14,091 civilians and 5,356 security force personnel lost their lives to militancy in Jammu and Kashmir between the 1990s and 2020.

217.title: Demolition drive begins in Guj's Himmatnagar after Ram Navami violence
217.article_body: A demolition drive was carried out against illegal structures in the Chhapariya locality of Gujarat's Himmatnagar weeks after communal clashes were reported in the city, officials said. Chief Municipal Officer Navneet Patel said, "Bulldozer has been launched by the municipality to remove illegal encroachments." Notably, communal clashes were erupted in the city during the Ram Navami celebration.

218.title: LIC IPO price band likely fixed at ₹902-₹949 per share: Reports
218.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO price band has likely been fixed at ₹902-₹949 per share, reports said on Tuesday. There will be a ₹60 discount for policyholders, the reports added. Previous reports said the LIC IPO will likely open on May 4 and close on May 9, with the government looking to raise ₹21,000 crore by diluting a 3.5% stake.

219.title: Thanks for giving me credit for the term 'multi-alignment': Tharoor to Jaishankar
219.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday posted a selfie with External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar from the Raisina Dialogue 2022 in Delhi. "Thanks for publicly giving me credit for the term 'Multi-alignment' (in the context of India's foreign policy) which I floated 15 years ago," said Tharoor. The term didn't have many takers 15 years ago, Tharoor said.

220.title: Had plans for 'Pirates of the...' ending before I was dropped: Depp
220.article_body: Amid Johnny Depp's defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard, the actor revealed that he was approached to take part in writing 'Pirates of the Caribbean 6' before he was released by Disney. "There's a way to end a franchise like that...I thought the characters should have a way out, to end the franchise on a very good note," he added.

221.title: Lok Sabha Speaker seeks details of Maha MP Navneet Rana's arrest
221.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has through the Ministry of Home Affairs asked for a "factual note" from the Maharashtra government on the arrest of Amravati MP Navneet Rana. This comes after Rana sent a letter to Birla alleging "inhumane treatment" by the police. Navneet was arrested after she gave a call for chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside the CM's home.

222.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Transport Bhawan, 4 tenders rushed to spot
222.article_body: A fire broke out in the Transport Bhawan on Parliament Street here on Tuesday, Delhi Fire Services officials said. According to the fire department, a call was received at 4:10 pm and four fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The fire began from an air-conditioner in one of the rooms of the Transport Bhawan, a senior official said.

223.title: Israel to reopen Gaza border crossing days after rocket attacks
223.article_body: Israel announced on Monday that it'll reopen its border crossing in Gaza Strip to Palestinian workers, days after it closed the point following rocket attacks from the Hamas-controlled area. The opening would be conditioned "on the maintenance of a stable security situation", an Israeli military body said. An estimated 12,000 Palestinians in Gaza cross over to Israel daily for work.

224.title: We're running out of adjectives, superlatives for Buttler: Pietersen
224.article_body: Praising RR opener Jos Buttler for his 65-ball 116 against DC in IPL 2022, Kevin Pietersen said, "We're running out of adjectives and superlatives. IPL is made incredible by...innings like these." He added, "He's such a fine talent and in such a sublime form." With 491 runs from seven matches so far, Buttler is currently the leading scorer in tournament.

225.title: Depp fails to recall his films in court, judge scolds people in courtroom for laughing
225.article_body: Johnny Depp left people laughing in the courtroom after he failed to name his movies in court. According to media reports, Johnny said, "I'm so pathetic when it comes to knowing what movies I've done...I don't watch them." As people laughed in the courtroom, the judge said to everyone, "Order in the court or I'll have you removed."

226.title: B'luru airport registers record growth in cargo volumes in FY 2022
226.article_body: The Kempegowda International airport has recorded its highest-ever cargo tonnage in fiscal year (FY) 2022, the Bengaluru International Airport Limited said. The airport processed 4,11,513 metric tonnes (MT) of cargo in FY 2022, recording a growth of 26% as against 3,26,643 MT in FY 2021. International cargo saw a growth of 31% and domestic cargo grew at 17%, it added.

227.title: 2 pilots try to swap planes at 12,000ft in video, fail as 1 plane nosedives in US
227.article_body: Two US pilots, Luke Aikins and Andy Farrington, trying to swap planes mid-air at 12,000 feet as a stunt failed after one of their planes nosedived. The video of the stunt shows both the pilots diving off the plane and Luke managing to take control of one plane mid-air. Meanwhile, Andy deployed his parachute as the other plane crashed.

228.title: Reliance Industries, UAE-based TA'ZIZ sign $2 billion JV for chemical project
228.article_body:
Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries on Tuesday signed a formal shareholder agreement with Abu Dhabi Chemical Derivatives Company RSC Ltd (TA'ZIZ) for Ruwais Chemicals Project. The shareholder agreement for the over $2 billion TA'ZIZ EDC & PVC joint venture was signed. TA'ZIZ EDC & PVC will produce Chlor-Alkali, Ethylene Dichloride and Polyvinyl Chloride for
the first time in the UAE.

229.title: Blac Chyna slashed Tyga with knife: Kylie Jenner says in court
229.article_body: Television personality Kylie Jenner has testified in court that her partner singer Tyga told her that reality star Blac Chyna slashed his arm with a knife when the two were together. This comes amid Chyna's defamation suit against the Kardashian family for purposefully interfering with her contract on Kylie's brother Rob and Chyna's spin-off of Keeping Up With the Kardashians.

230.title: Trailer looks familiar yet different: Vidya on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
230.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan on Tuesday shared the trailer of film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' on social media, writing, "The trailer looks familiar yet different...Can't wait to experience this roller-coaster ride again." Vidya had portrayed the role of Avni who had dissociative identity disorder and believed herself to be Manjulika in the first film. The sequel stars Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani.

231.title: PM Modi to interact with CMs on COVID-19 situation tomorrow
231.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will interact with Chief Ministers of all states via video conferencing on Wednesday over the prevailing COVID-19 situation in India. This comes as some states and UTs, including Delhi, are reporting a rise in daily COVID-19 cases. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, India reported over 2,000 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

232.title: Police use water cannon to diffuse BJP rally protesting against Mamata govt
232.article_body: West Bengal Police on Tuesday dispersed BJP workers who were taking out a protest rally, led by BJP's Tejasvi Surya against Mamata Banerjee led government in the state with a water cannon. Meanwhile, Tejasvi Surya was on Tuesday asked by the Delhi Police to join the investigation in connection with alleged vandalism at Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence.

233.title: ED raids ABG Shipyard premises in India's biggest bank fraud case: Reports
233.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) reportedly carried out raids at 26 premises linked to Mumbai-based ABG Shipyard on Tuesday. The company is accused of defrauding 28 banks of ₹22,842 crore in India's biggest bank fraud case ever. The raids were conducted at multiple premises of ABG Shipyard, its sister companies, as well as executives, in Mumbai, Pune and Surat, reports said.

234.title: Death Of Remakes: RGV on Bollywood remakes of South films
234.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma posted a series of tweets criticising Bollywood remakes of South films with the hashtag #DeathOfRemakes. He wrote if Nani-starrer Telugu film 'Jersey' was dubbed, it would've cost ₹10 lakh, while the Shahid Kapoor-starrer remake cost ₹100 crore which lost "enormous money...and face". "#Pushpa #RRR #KGF2...doing far better than originals if...content is good," he added.

235.title: SEBI attaches Greentouch Projects' assets in illegal fundraising case
235.article_body: Market regulator SEBI has attached 14 properties related to Greentouch Projects and its four directors in an illegal fundraising case to recover ₹56 crore of investors' money. The attached properties include land parcels, plots, office spaces and a flat located in West Bengal and Uttar Pradesh. The company claims to have already repaid over ₹12.24 crore to its investors.

236.title: B'luru Police arrest man for drug peddling, seize drugs worth ₹6.5 lakh
236.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a man for drug peddling in the city and seized drugs estimated to be around ₹6.5 lakh from his possession, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said. The drugs, which have been recovered, include MDMA crystal, ecstasy pills and chassis. Further, a mobile phone, laptop and electronic weighing machine have also been recovered.

237.title: Europe must look beyond Ukraine, world threw Afghanistan under the bus: Jaishankar
237.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, while responding to questions on the Russia-Ukraine war from European leaders, said it was a "wake-up call" for Europe to look at pressing issues in other parts of the world. Referring to challenges that Asia is facing, Jaishankar said, "Less than a year ago in Afghanistan...an entire...society was thrown under the bus by the world."

238.title: JNU may be politically charged, but isn't anti-national: VC
238.article_body: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) Vice Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit said the university may be "politically charged" but it's not "anti-national". "More than 60% of the bureaucracy...is from this very university. Over 90% of the students are apolitical, and they've come here to make a career...[any] negative branding will affect them when they go out to get jobs," Pandit said.

239.title: 2 children among 4 dead after shooting at Russian school: Report
239.article_body: Three individuals, including a teacher and two children, were shot dead after a man opened fire at kindergarten school in Russia's Ulyanovsk region on Tuesday, local authorities told AFP. The accused, whose identity is yet to be revealed, reportedly killed himself after attack. The ages of the dead children would be between 3 and 6 years old, an official said.

240.title: Twitter Co-founder Dorsey eligible for $978 mn cash payout after Musk's deal: Reports
240.article_body: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey, who owns a 2.4% stake in the company, is eligible for a $978 million cash payout after Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter for $44 billion, according to reports. According to Musk's deal, he would be buying about 18,042,428 shares of Twitter that are owned by Dorsey for $54.20 each, the reports added.

241.title: Railways must pay compensation if person falls off crowded train: HC
241.article_body: The Bombay High Court said that Railways will have to pay compensation to people who suffer injuries after falling while attempting to board an overcrowded train. The court also directed Western Railways to pay ₹3 lakh to a man who was injured after falling off an overcrowded local train. In 2013, Railway Claims Tribunal had rejected the victim's compensation claim.

242.title: CM KCR lays foundation stone for 3 super-speciality hospitals in Hyd
242.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Tuesday laid the foundation stone for three Telangana Institute of Medical Sciences (TIMS) super-speciality hospitals in Hyderabad. The three hospitals, for which the state government has already sanctioned the amount of ₹2,679 crore, will be established at LB Nagar, Sanathnagar and Alwal. Health Minister T Harish Rao and other ministers also accompanied the CM.

243.title: Aren't Hindi films remade in South? Abhishek Bachchan on remakes
243.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan, on being asked about Bollywood remakes of South Indian films, said, "Are you telling me...Hindi films aren't...remade in the South?" He further said that films have always been remade and it's not a new phenomenon. "The exchange doesn't happen because there is a dearth of ideas...It is a choice we make as a creator," the actor added.

244.title: Jakhar wishes Congress luck as panel recommends his 2-year suspension
244.article_body: Shortly after the Congress disciplinary panel recommended his two-year suspension on Tuesday, former Punjab Congress chief Sunil Jakhar wished his party good luck. The party's disciplinary committee had on April 11 given a show-cause notice to Jakhar for alleged anti-party activities and sought a reply within a week. He had called former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh Channi a liability.

245.title: Will move heaven & Earth to help Ukraine win battle against Russia: US
245.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin on Tuesday vowed to move "heaven and earth" to "help Ukraine win the fight against Russia's unjust invasion", as allies from 40 nations met to bolster Kyiv's defence against Moscow. Austin added that US and its allies have committed over $5 billion of equipment to support Ukraine's defence since the war began on February 24.

246.title: Ukraine war could be wake-up call for Europe to look at Asia's situation: EAM
246.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the Russia-Ukraine war could be a "wake-up call" for Europe to also look at Asia's situation. "Things have been happening in Asia for the last 10 years. Europe may not have looked at it," he said. It's important to recognise that the "rules-based order has been under continuous stress" in Asia, Jaishankar added.

247.title: More than me Congress needs leadership: Prashant Kishor after declining to join party
247.article_body: After declining to join Congress, poll strategist Prashant Kishor tweeted, "In my humble opinion, more than me the party needs leadership and collective will to fix the deep rooted structural problems through transformational reforms." He declined the offer to join the party's Empowered Action Group and also to take responsibility for elections.

248.title: Quite surprising: Vettori on PBKS' Rishi Dhawan bowling the final over vs CSK
248.article_body: Reacting to PBKS all-rounder Rishi Dhawan bowling the final over in PBKS' win against CSK, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said, "I can't imagine...they had planned on giving him the final over, it was quite surprising." Discussing CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja's unbeaten 21 off 16 balls, Vettori said Jadeja could have been a "little more" aggressive.

249.title: Ukraine's problems today will be ours tomorrow: Estonian PM amid war
249.article_body: Speaking about Russian invasion of Ukraine, Estonian PM Kaja Kallas said in an interview that Ukraine's problems today will be "our problems tomorrow". Kallas added that countries, including Germany, should adopt a more assertive role in ending the war in Ukraine so as to lessen burden of war refugees. "NATO is a defensive alliance, we're in this together," she added.

250.title: Biden pardons ex-Secret Service agent, reduces sentences for 75 others
250.article_body: US President Joe Biden issued three pardons and 75 prison sentence commutations in his first grants of clemency. All the commutations and two of the three pardons went to people convicted of federal drug offences. The third pardon was given to an 86-year-old ex-US Secret Service agent, Abraham Bolden Sr, who was the first African-American to serve on presidential detail.

251.title: Ranveer dances with Alia to Dholida in BTS video from Gangubai Kathiawadi sets
251.article_body: Ranveer Singh danced with Alia Bhatt on her song 'Dholida' from 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' during the filming of the music video. Saregama Music shared a behind-the-scenes video of the making of the song. Speaking about Dholida in the clip, Ranveer said, "The song is [a] hit." He then performs the hook step of the song with Alia and the background dancers.

252.title: 2 die as wall collapses in Delhi's Keshav Puram, 2nd incident in 24 hrs
252.article_body: Two people died as a wall collapsed in Delhi's Keshav Puram area as the national capital reported a second similar incident in the last 24 hours. "The two persons were rescued from under the debris and rushed to Deep Chand Bandhu Hospital where the doctors declared them brought dead," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (northwest) Usha Rangnani.

253.title: Honorarium of mid-day meal cooks increased by the UP Cabinet
253.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government in a meeting chaired by UP CM Yogi Adityanath approved a proposal to raise the honorarium of mid-day meal cooks posted in the state's Basic Education Department. The honorarium of 3,77,520 cooks, engaged in preparing food in the schools under the mid-day meal scheme, has been raised from ₹1,500 to ₹2,000.

254.title: 32.79 lakh foreigners visited India in 2020 despite restrictions: MHA
254.article_body: More than 32.79 lakh foreigners visited India in 2020 despite restrictions, according to a report by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA). The maximum number of foreigners who visited India between April 1, 2020, and December 31, 2020, were from the US (61,190). This was followed by people from Bangladesh (37,774), the UK (33,323) and Canada (13,707), the report added.

255.title: Crew was in Ukraine before war, can't contact 3 actors: 'Love in..' director
255.article_body: Filmmaker Nitin Gupta said that the entire crew of his film 'Love in Ukraine' was in Ukraine before the war started and that they are unable to contact three actors now. "Liza, who is also from Ukraine, is stuck somewhere at the Ukraine border and efforts are being made to bring her to India for the film promotions," he added.

256.title: Aarohi came into my life & changed everything: Shraddha on 9 yrs of Aashiqui 2
256.article_body: As her film 'Aashiqui 2' completed nine years of release on Tuesday, actress Shraddha Kapoor said, "Aarohi (her character's name) came into my life, and changed everything." "I am forever grateful and thankful to each and everyone who gave so much love to me as Aarohi," she added. Directed by Mohit Suri, 'Aashiqui 2' also starred Aditya Roy Kapur.

257.title: Ranbir says 'Say hi to my wife' post varmala with Alia, video goes viral
257.article_body: A video of actor Ranbir Kapoor introducing actress Alia Bhatt after their varmala ceremony at their wedding has surfaced online. In the video, Ranbir can be heard saying, "Say hi to my wife." To this, Alia also greeted everyone. Ranbir can be seen kneeling in the video while the varmalas were being exchanged between the two.

258.title: Anil Deshmukh gets clean chit in money laundering case
258.article_body: Chandiwal Commission has given a clean chit to  former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a money laundering case. The one member high-level enquiry commission was chaired by Justice (retired) Kailash Chandiwal to probe corruption allegations levelled by former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh against Deshmukh. The commission's report was also submitted to CM Uddhav Thackeray.

259.title: Man kills second wife over her 'argumentative nature' in Delhi
259.article_body: A 36-year-old man allegedly killed his second wife in Delhi's Narela area, police said on Monday. The deceased woman was initially raped by her husband's friend and she was later strangulated to death by her husband, police said. According to the police, the accused man said that he was fed up with his wife as she had an argumentative nature.

260.title: Farhan proposed to me for marriage in Maldives; it was unexpected: Shibani
260.article_body: Shibani Dandekar revealed Farhan Akhtar proposed to her for marriage in the Maldives. She said it was "very unexpected." Shibani added she had no idea about it. "We hadn't even discussed it. But this is again Farhan, when he decides something, he does it," she said. Shibani further added she wasn't the kind of person who wanted to get married.

261.title: Was there nothing better to do with $44 billion: Simu on Musk's Twitter takeover
261.article_body: Hollywood celebrities reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal. Shang-Chi actor, Simu Liu tweeted, "Was there nothing better to do with 44 billion dollars?" Priyanka Chopra's brother-in-law, singer Kevin Jonas wrote, "Will we now get the edit tweet option?" In a joint statement with Twitter, Musk said that he wants to make the Twitter service "better than ever".

262.title: SC agrees to list pleas challenging K'taka HC's hijab ban in educational institutions
262.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to list appeals challenging the Karnataka High Court order upholding the hijab ban in educational institutions. CJI NV Ramana asked senior advocate Meenakshi Arora to "wait for two days" when she mentioned the matter and said that he will list it soon. CJI Ramana has also urged parties not to sensationalise the matter.

263.title: Didn't want them without purpose: 'Bhool...' maker on not casting Akshay, Vidya
263.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee, while speaking about not casting Vidya Balan and Akshay Kumar in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', said, "The script didn't give us the liberty to bring them onboard." "We didn't want to bring the two onboard without any purpose...This story did not permit us to bring them," he added. The upcoming film stars Kartik Aaryan, Kiara Advani and Tabu.

264.title: So many roles and genres still haven't come my way: Saif Ali Khan
264.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan has said that there are several roles and genres that have not come his way. However, he added, "It's not really about the genre. It's about doing the same thing differently and doing it better." "So, even the roles that I've...done, I think I would approach them differently [if I do them now]," Saif further stated.

265.title: I felt a 'blinding hurt': Depp on reading ex-wife Amber Heard's op-ed
265.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp said he felt a "blinding hurt" after reading ex-wife Amber Heard's op-ed which claimed that Heard was a victim of domestic violence. "It was like somebody had hit me in the back of the head with a 2x4," added Depp. Depp has sued Heard for defamation over her op-ed which was written in 2018.

266.title: Aus, NZ decide not to send athletes for this year's Asian Games
266.article_body: Australia will not be sending its athletes to the Asian Games for the first time this year and similarly, New Zealand has confirmed that their athletes too won't be going to Hangzhou in September this year. Notably, the Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) had invited a quota of around 450 contingent members from Oceania nations, including Australia and New Zealand.

267.title: Tibetans being forced to speak Chinese: Report
267.article_body: Officials from China are forcing people in rural Tibet to speak in Chinese, a report said. It is part of China's campaign to restrict Tibetans from using their native languages, it added. A 10-day workshop was reportedly conducted in Kongpo to promote Chinese as the main language of communication. The local administrators were asked to conduct business only in Chinese.

268.title: Cancer patient posts pic of him giving interview amid treatment, gets hired
268.article_body: A cancer patient's post on recruiters rejecting him due to the disease has gone viral. Posting a picture of him giving an interview amid chemo, Arsh Prasad said, "I don't need...sympathy! I'm here to prove myself." Applied Cloud Computing CEO Nilesh Satpute commented, "Please stop attending interviews...I checked your credentials, they're very strong. You can join us...There'll be no interview."

269.title: Disney rejects Saudi's demand to cut LGBT scene in Doctor Strange 2
269.article_body: Disney has refused Saudi Arabia's demand to cut same-sex relationship references from 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. A Saudi official stated that the film will never be banned in the country but they are still negotiating with Disney. Earlier, Warner Bros had been criticised for cutting same-sex romance references in 'Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore' for China.

270.title: TN man gets death penalty for beheading minor Dalit girl for rejecting advances
270.article_body: A court in Tamil Nadu awarded death sentence to a 26-year-old man for beheading a minor Dalit girl for allegedly rejecting his sexual advances. The incident occurred on October 22, 2018, when the accused, identified as Dinesh Kumar, barged into the house of the 14-year-old victim and killed her. The accused had also attacked the girl's mother.

271.title: My intro in 'Parinda' is one of the world's 'worst' performances: Anil
271.article_body: Discussing his 1989 film 'Parinda', actor Anil Kapoor said, "My introduction [sequence]...is one of the worst performances in the world. I want to reshoot it." "I was being my full-on self," added Anil. 'Parinda' also starred actor Jackie Shroff who had earlier revealed that he slapped Anil 17 times for a scene in the film.

272.title: 6th round of sanctions against Russia expected very soon: EU
272.article_body: The European Union's energy policy chief Kadri Simson said a sixth package of sanctions against Russia over Ukraine invasion is expected "very soon". Reportedly, the sixth package may include some form of oil embargo. In its previous packages, the 27-nation bloc had backed a ban on coal and removed a number of Russian banks from the SWIFT financial system.

273.title: Human Rights Watch head to step down after nearly 3 decades
273.article_body: Human Rights Watch (HRW) Executive Director Kenneth Roth said he'd step down at the end of August after running the global rights watchdog for nearly three decades. "Under Roth's leadership, HRW grew from a staff of about 60 with a $7 million budget to 552 covering over 100 countries and a nearly $100 million budget," the New York-based group said.

274.title: I've grown up watching Akshay, it's better not to compare: Kartik on 'Bhool..'
274.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that it is better to not compare him with Akshay Kumar in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "I can't compare because it's too big a shoe to fill. I had loved him in Bhool Bhulaiyaa 1, and have grown up watching him...Comparisons will happen...but I hope 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' will be remembered as a new film," he added.

275.title: Was aware of CSK's plan to bowl wide yorkers at me: Dhawan
275.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 88(59) against CSK on Monday, Punjab Kings batter Shikhar Dhawan has said that he was aware of CSK bowlers' plan "to bowl wide yorkers" at him. "During my innings, I had in my mind intentions to attack the shorter side of the field, though not a specific bowler...I was aware of their plans," Dhawan said.

276.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar; 9 fire tenders on spot
276.article_body: A fire broke out in the Amar Colony area of Delhi's Lajpat Nagar on Tuesday afternoon, ANI reported. Following the incident, around nine fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the flames. A video shared by ANI showed smoke billowing out of the building in Amar Colony. However, no casualties have been reported in the incident so far.

277.title: Gujarat policeman arrested for taking ₹2 lakh bribe in Gurugram
277.article_body: A police inspector, Jagdish Chaudhary, of the Gujarat Police was caught red-handed accepting a bribe of ₹2 lakh from a Gurugram resident in Sector 49 on Sunday, officials said on Monday. Chaudhary had given an assurance to weaken a cheating case against the complainant's nephew, according to officials. Chaudhary had accepted ₹1 lakh from the complainant on April 12.

278.title: Mumbai Police video shows MP-MLA couple having tea in custody after ill-treatment claim
278.article_body: After Amravati MP Navneet Rana alleged "inhumane treatment" by police, Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey shared a video showing Navneet and her husband MLA Ravi Rana having tea in the Khar Police Station. "Do we say anything more," the Police chief captioned the video. Meanwhile, the Union Home Ministry has sought a factual report from Maharashtra government over Navneet's allegation.

279.title: Section 144 imposed in Maharashtra's Aurangabad ahead of Raj Thackeray's rally
279.article_body: Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, ahead of MNS chief Raj Thackeray's rally on May 1. Restrictions will remain in force in the district till May 9. Thackeray had earlier announced the rally to protest against the recital of 'azaan' from loudspeakers at mosques and had demanded the removal of these loudspeakers by May 3.

280.title: People took me more seriously after 'Dil Dhadakne Do': Pawan Chopra
280.article_body: Actor Pawan Chopra said people started taking him more "seriously" after his performance in the film 'Dil Dhadakne Do', which also starred Ranveer Singh, Anushka Sharma. "Filmmakers now have the conviction that I can pull off any character," added Pawan. Pawan stated that he started working in films as it was not exciting playing the same roles in television shows.

281.title: Depp's a huge narcissist, he was overacting during the trial: Howard Stern
281.article_body: Discussing actor Johnny Depp's ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard, American radio personality Howard Stern said, "The reason he wanted...it televised [is because] that's what narcissists do." "Depp is a huge narcissist," added Stern. "I will play you some clips from the...trial. Depp's so overacting because he's writing his own material as he goes along," stated Stern.

282.title: Operation Romeo's Sidhant to star in Vikramaditya's series on film industry
282.article_body: Sidhant Gupta, who was most recently seen in the film 'Operation Romeo', has reportedly teamed up with filmmaker Vikramaditya Motwane for a new series, tentatively titled 'Stardust'. According to reports, the eight-episode series is inspired by true events and will highlight the work culture of the film industry. The makers are planning to release the show this year, reports stated.

283.title: Usyk to raise funds for Ukraine through his bout against Joshua: Report
283.article_body: Olympic gold medallist boxer Oleksandr Usyk will raise relief funds for his native Ukraine through his bout against UK's Anthony Joshua which is expected to be held later this year. "Many people in Ukraine are now seeking help. We think that as soon as it's released, many people will actually receive this help," the unified heavyweight champion told Reuters.

284.title: Maharashtra's peak power demand met successfully: Electricity board
284.article_body: Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) said that it met the state's peak power demand of the season amid rising demand and further avoided load shedding. "On Sunday, MSEDCL provided 26,468 MV without any load shedding in the state," an official release added. "Also, on Monday, there was no load shedding across the state," MSEDCL stated.

285.title: Extremists suspected to have infiltrated Canadian military: Report
285.article_body: Violent extremists such as the white supremacists are suspected to have infiltrated the Canadian Armed Forces and the military isn't doing enough to prevent it, a report released by Defence Minister Anita Anand said. It said that the efforts to detect the extremists were inefficient and the infiltrators were adept at avoiding getting caught.

286.title: Blast at Karachi University, 3 Chinese nationals among 4 reportedly killed
286.article_body: At least four people were killed and several others were injured in a blast that occurred inside the premises of the University of Karachi in Pakistan, reports said. Three of those killed are reportedly Chinese nationals, they added. The blast took place at around 2 pm in a van near Confucius Institute, reports said.

287.title: Twinkle Khanna's short story Salaam Noni Appa to be made into a film
287.article_body: A new movie based on Twinkle Khanna's short story 'Salaam Noni Appa' from her 2016 anthology 'The Legend of Lakshmi Prasad' is in the works. The yet-untitled film will be jointly produced by Applause Entertainment, Ellipsis Entertainment and Twinkle's Mrs Funnybones Movies. Twinkle said that the short story 'Salaam Noni Appa' is loosely based on her grandmother and her sister.

288.title: We aren't getting good starts in first 6 overs: Jadeja on CSK's 6th loss
288.article_body: Following CSK's sixth defeat in IPL 2022 after losing to PBKS by 11 runs on Monday, CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said his side is lacking in getting good starts in the first six overs this season. Chasing 188-run target, CSK were reduced to 40/3 after seven overs. "Hopefully we'll come back stronger," he added. CSK are currently ninth in standings.

289.title: Mumbai Police filed fake FIR in my name: BJP leader Kirit Somaiya
289.article_body: Former BJP MP Kirit Somaiya on Tuesday claimed that a fake FIR was filed in his name at Khar Police Station in Mumbai which he had not even signed. Somaiya criticised Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey over the issue and also claimed that Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray had sent some "goons" to attack him.

290.title: Arrange Ayodhya trips for Pune residents: Patil to ex-corporators
290.article_body:
Ahead of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) elections, Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil
has urged ex-corporators to maintain a "public connect" with people. Patil added that the former corporators should arrange trips to Ayodhya for the residents, where construction of the Ram Mandir is underway. "[BJP] can win PMC elections when the organisation is alive and powerful," he added.

291.title: Cong panel recommends ex-Punjab unit chief Sunil Jakhar's suspension for 2 yrs
291.article_body: The Congress disciplinary committee on Tuesday recommended suspension of its former Punjab unit chief Sunil Jakhar from the organisation for two years over anti-party activities. The panel has also recommended that veteran party leader from Kerala, KV Thomas, be removed from all party posts. The final call on the panel's recommendations will be taken by Congress President Sonia Gandhi.

292.title: Prashant Kishor declines offer to join Congress
292.article_body: Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala on Tuesday announced that poll strategist Prashant Kishor has declined Congress' offer to join the party. ''Following a presentation & discussions with Sh Prashant Kishor, Congress President has constituted an Empowered Action Group 2024 & invited him to join the party as part of the group with defined responsibility. He declined," he tweeted.

293.title: Suriya donates vehicle worth ₹6 lakh to Tamil Nadu police department
293.article_body: Actor Suriya's production house donated a vehicle worth ₹6 lakh to the Tamil Nadu police department's 'Kaval Karangal' initiative. The 'Kaval Karangal' initiative has been launched by the Tamil Nadu Police with the aim of providing help to needy people. Reportedly the vehicle donated by the actor's production house would be used to deliver food to the homeless people.

294.title: Today, actors decide if film is hit, give money to Insta friends: Nawazuddin
294.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said only streaming platforms can know if a film is a hit or a flop. "But today...even actors...decide if their film is hit or flop...They have four friends on Instagram. They pay money to them [for posts]," he said, adding he doubts if English-speaking actors will be able to do justice to gangster series.

295.title: China rejects speculation it may try to influence Twitter after Musk's deal
295.article_body: Chinese foreign ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin has rejected the speculation that Beijing could try to use leverage over Tesla in order to influence Twitter. This came after Elon Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion. Following the deal, Amazon's Jeff Bezos had tweeted, "Did the Chinese government just gain a bit of leverage over the town square?"

296.title: In a first since 2020, Andhra reported 0 COVID cases in a day
296.article_body: Andhra Pradesh reported zero COVID-19 cases on Monday, making it the first time since March 2020 that such a feat was achieved by the state. However, there are still 22 active COVID-19 cases in the state. Notably, the Visakha Institute of Medical Sciences is the only institute in the state to host nasal COVID-19 vaccine trials.

297.title: 2 women killed as mine collapses in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri
297.article_body: At least two women were killed after a mine collapsed while they were digging out its soil in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district on Monday evening, police said. The incident took place near a canal of the Sular river, police added. While digging, they went deep into the cave-shaped mine which later collapsed on them, police further said.

298.title: 3 Kashmiri students, charged with sedition, get out of Agra jail
298.article_body: Three Kashmiri students, who were charged with sedition for allegedly cheering for Pakistan in a T20 World Cup match, were released from Agra jail on Monday. They were stuck in jail despite being granted bail by Allahabad High Court nearly a month ago for want of guarantors. Earlier, a relative of an accused had expressed inability to pay surety deposit.

299.title: Olympic snowboarding champion Chloe Kim to take break for mental health
299.article_body: Double Olympic snowboarding champion Chloe Kim said that she will skip the 2022-23 season to focus on her mental health. "Just want to kind of reset...don't want to get right back into it after such a fun, but draining year, at the same time," said the 22-year-old American snowboarder. Kim has previously taken a break after the 2018 Winter Games.

300.title: Bengaluru Police solves ₹1 crore robbery case using FASTag details
300.article_body: The Bengaluru Police has solved a ₹1 crore robbery case using FASTag details of the accused's car and arrested ten members of the Kerala gang. The accused reportedly attacked a vehicle carrying five employees of a private finance firm and looted their money. They kept changing the number plate of the car but were later tracked with their FASTag details.

301.title: Zayed Khan shares pics of his transformation, calls Hrithik Roshan his mentor
301.article_body: Actor Zayed Khan took to Instagram to share pictures from a photoshoot and spoke about his "transformative journey". "Every 5 days I will share a new array of pictures that exposes the transformed 'Zayed Khan'," he wrote. Zayed also thanked his family members along with "brother and mentor" Hrithik Roshan, further thanking fitness trainer Satyajit Chourasia.

302.title: Virat Kohli texted me 'Lottery lag gayi bhai': Harshal on RCB buying him for ₹10.75 crore
302.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel revealed that after RCB bought him for ₹10.75 crore at the IPL mega auction, Virat Kohli texted him, "Lottery lag gayi bhai." Harshal added, "I replied, 'Haan bhai lag gayi. Way beyond my expectations'." Harshal added, "Money is great but for me the central goal of my life is freedom."

303.title: 3-4 people from IPL teams said they'll bid for me but didn't: Harshal on 2018 auction
303.article_body: Referring to IPL 2018 auction wherein he was bought at his base price by DC, RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel revealed that three to four people from several franchises had told him that they will bid for him but didn't. "It felt like betrayal. [I felt like] 'They lied to me, I have been misled'," Harshal said.

304.title: Taiwan to include lessons from Russia-Ukraine war in military drills
304.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Ministry said the island will incorporate lessons learned from the Russian invasion of Ukraine into upcoming military exercises. This year's Han Kuang exercises, Taiwan's largest annual war games, are aimed at practising fighting off a Chinese attack, it added. Taiwan has raised its alert level since the invasion. China claims democratically governed Taiwan as its own territory.

305.title: Karunanidhi's birthday to be celebrated as govt function in TN: CM Stalin
305.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said on Tuesday that late DMK supremo and ex-CM M Karunanidhi's birth anniversary (June 3) will henceforth be marked as a government function. Stalin, who is Karunanidhi's son, added that stalwart's statue will be unveiled at Chennai's Omandurar estate. Karunanidhi, a five-time CM, had never lost an election in his life, Stalin also pointed out.

306.title: Uttarakhand CM visits Kedarnath to review Yatra related preparations
306.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami visited Kedarnath on Tuesday to review Kedarnath Yatra-related preparations. "This year, hotels, cabs, taxis etc are being booked two months prior, hence, we are expecting it to break all records this time," the CM said. According to the announcement at Omkareshwar Temple, the portals of Kedarnath Temple will open for public on May 6.

307.title: Tesla welcome to India, but it must not import cars from China: Gadkari
307.article_body: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said that electric carmaker Tesla is welcome to set up shop in India, make cars for sale and export them, but the company must not import cars from China. "Making in China and selling here is not a good proposition," Gadkari said. Tesla has been working for a year to get tax breaks from India.

308.title: 2 men tried to remove my clothes and rape me inside college washroom: UP student
308.article_body: A BSc student in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj has said that she was molested by two men in her college's washroom. "The two men were wearing face masks so I couldn't recognise them but I had bitten one of the accused's hand. They even tried to remove my clothes and rape me but I somehow managed the escape," she added.

309.title: Shibani's vibrancy brought balance in our marriage: Farhan Akhtar
309.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar, speaking about his wife Shibani Dandekar, has said that a "certain vibrancy" about the actress was something he found attractive. "While I'm the non-talker, Shibani can talk to anyone and anything! Even a tree," he added. "It brought in...a sweet balance in our relationship, now marriage," he said. The duo tied the knot on February 19.

310.title: UP govt to set up 2 new police stations in Lucknow Police Commissionerate
310.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday said two new police stations will be set up in the Lucknow Police Commissionerate. This will help in strengthening law and order and provide easy availability of police services to the general public, the Chief Minister's Office tweeted. The government will set up the new police stations at Madehganj and Dubagga.

311.title: It changes equation between two people: Pulkit on marriage plans with Kriti
311.article_body: When asked about his wedding plans with his girlfriend, actress Kriti Kharbanda, actor Pulkit Samrat said, "My funda is simple, as long as you are living as best friends things are sorted. Your arguments and love are all friendly." "When it comes to marriage, it tends to sometimes change this equation between the two individuals," he added.

312.title: Hopeful Moeen recovers from ankle injury in 7 days: CSK head coach Fleming
312.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming said he's hopeful that team's all-rounder Moeen Ali, who hurt his ankle in the training session on Saturday, will make a quick recovery in a week's time as there is no fracture. Moeen missed Monday's match against PBKS in IPL 2022. He has scored 87 runs and has gone wicketless in five matches so far.

313.title: Ukraine can win war with Russia: US
313.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin began defence talks with over 40 countries on Tuesday by saying that Ukraine can prevail against Russia in the two-month-old conflict. "Ukraine clearly believes that it can win, and so does everyone here," he said. "Your resistance has brought inspiration to the free world," Austin further said.

314.title: Couldn't refuse projects with seniors, felt why take panga? Shreyas
314.article_body: Actor Shreyas Talpade has revealed that he was offered films by some seniors and known banners but he couldn't say no since he was new in the industry. "You feel why take any panga (trouble) because they'll feel bad if you turn down their projects," he added. Shreyas further said things changed for him after doing 'Apna Sapna Money Money'.

315.title: 17-yr-old Tripura girl, boyfriend die by suicide after being summoned by police
315.article_body: A 17-year-old girl and her 21-year-old boyfriend allegedly died by suicide after they were summoned to a police station in Tripura's Gomati district, an officer said. The summons came after a complaint was lodged by the girl's father, who claimed that his daughter had been abducted. The couple took the step after anticipating trouble, the officer added.

316.title: Shammi Kapoor didn't marry Mumtaz, he wanted someone to look after kids: Son
316.article_body: Late veteran actor Shammi Kapoor's son Aditya has spoken about the former's affair with actress Mumtaz, saying "the meeting of minds didn't happen". He added Shammi wanted someone to look after his kids while Mumtaz was close to signing a film with Rajesh Khanna. "I don't think Dad was wrong...I don't think Mumtazji was wrong either...to concentrate on...career," Aditya said.

317.title: Neighbour slashes woman's throat over water dispute in south Delhi
317.article_body: A 48-year-old woman was allegedly murdered by her neighbour on Tuesday after a dispute over fetching water at the Dalit Ekta camp in south Delhi's Vasant Kunj area. Arjun (the accused) slashed Shyam Kala's (the victim) throat with a knife, causing her instant death. Kala's son said Arjun attacked him and his father as well when they tried to intervene.

318.title: SDMC orders probe in Delhi building collapse, says building was 'unsafe'
318.article_body: South Delhi Municipal Corporation Mayor Mukesh Suryan has ordered an investigation after a building undergoing renovation collapsed in the Satya Niketan area on Monday, killing two labourers. Suryan said that the building was "unsafe" and they had earlier warned its owner against carrying out the renovation works. "It seems like illegal construction was going on in the building," he added.

319.title: Noida Police arrest 3 members of gang stealing two-wheelers in NCR
319.article_body: Noida Police on Monday said that three members of a gang involved in stealing two-wheelers in the NCR region have been arrested. The police also said that they've recovered 28 two-wheelers and also impounded a truck used by the gang to transport the stolen vehicles. The gang used to sell the stolen bikes in parts to scrap dealers, they added.

320.title: You got Twitter out of an impossible situation: Dorsey to Musk, Parag
320.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey thanked Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal and Elon Musk after Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for about $44 billion. "Thank you both for getting the company out of an impossible situation," tweeted Dorsey. He further said that both Musk and Agrawal have a goal of creating a platform that is "maximally trusted and broadly inclusive".

321.title: 'I also have no light' tweets Goa Electricity Dept; chat with users goes viral
321.article_body: Goa Electricity Department tweeted about power cuts and wrote, "I also have no lights and would be anytime fading away from you all until supply is restored." "I'm also a consumer like you, now out of office but only a dept person on twitter. No special service to me," it responded to a user. The tweets have now been deleted.

322.title: 5, including 2 children, killed as car crashes into truck in Maharashtra
322.article_body: As many as five persons, including two children, were killed and four others were seriously injured when the car they were travelling in crashed into a stationary truck in Maharashtra's Solapur on Monday, officials said. The victims, residents of Miraj, were on their way to Karnataka's Hubli, officials added. The car was moving at a very high speed, officials stated.

323.title: Emmy-winning actress Jean Smart honoured with star on H'wood Walk of Fame
323.article_body: Multiple Primetime Emmy Award-winning actress Jean Smart has become the latest celebrity to get a star on Hollywood Walk of Fame. The 70-year-old actress, known for shows like 'Fargo' and 'Mare of Easttown', was honoured with a star on April 25. "We're proud to add her distinguished name to...Hollywood Walk of Fame," stated Ana Martinez, Hollywood Walk of Fame Producer.

324.title: Akshay should play father with younger actor as son in 'Waqt...' remake: Vipul
324.article_body: 'Waqt: The Race Against Time' director Vipul Shah said that if actor Akshay Kumar is ready for a remake of the film, he should play the father's role and a younger actor should be cast as the son. Vipul added that Akshay has a soft spot for father-son stories because he was very close to his father.

325.title: Upset with attitude of Cong disciplinary committee: Sunil Jakhar
325.article_body: After being issued a show-cause notice by the Congress disciplinary committee, senior Punjab Congress leader Sunil Jakhar has said that he is angry and upset with the attitude of the committee. "For years, I have acted as a disciplined worker of the Congress party," Jakhar, who has been summoned for allegedly making controversial statements against the party leaders, said.

326.title: Saudi PIF head committed to take Tesla private with me: Musk
326.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to a news channel discussing texts between Saudi PIF and him, saying, "The head of Saudi PIF committed unequivocally to take Tesla private with me, as witnessed by...Tesla CFO and several others." The channel said the texts "confirm they were serious about taking Tesla private". "That is why I said funding was secured," Musk added.

327.title: Ameesha Patel accused of cheating, actress says she 'feared for her life' at MP event
327.article_body: A police complaint has been lodged against Ameesha Patel over alleged cheating. According to the complaint, she staged an "extremely brief performance" at an event in Madhya Pradesh. Ameesha had allegedly charged around ₹4 lakh for one hour's performance but performed for only 3 minutes. However,  Ameesha tweeted the event was badly organised and that she "feared for her life".

328.title: India creates world record for waving 78,000 national flags simultaneously
328.article_body: India has entered the Guinness Book of World Records for the simultaneous waving of national flags, breaking Pakistan's record created 18 years ago in the same activity. Over 78,000 people waved the Tricolour simultaneously at an event, setting the record in Bihar on April 23. Home Minister Amit Shah participated in the event and also waved the Tricolour.

329.title: Pune's 1st heart transplant of the year saves life of 59-yr-old man
329.article_body: The first heart transplant in Pune this year was performed on Monday at Sahyadri Hospital after a medical team transported the organ from Kolhapur within two-and-a-half hours via green corridor. The liver and kidneys of 25-year-old donor, whose heart was transplanted into a 59-year-old veterinary doctor, were also donated to other hospitals. The receiver was suffering from end-stage heart failure.

330.title: Everything happened as per plan, Punjab way is attacking way: Bhanuka Rajapaksa
330.article_body: PBKS' Bhanuka Rajapaksa has said everything happened as per their plan as they defeated CSK by 11 runs in their match on Monday. "It was not the greatest wicket to bat on when we started. We had a shorter side, so we knew what we had to do. We had a plan...the Punjab way is the attacking way," he stated.

331.title: MP govt to give ₹900/month to farmers rearing indigenous cows: CM
331.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday said that farmers who rear indigenous cows will be given ₹900/month, which will amount to ₹10,800/year. Chouhan, who was addressing a NITI Aayog workshop, also announced the formation of a board to promote natural farming. "Desi (indigenous) cows are essential for natural farming…Farmers should rear at least one desi cow," he added.

332.title: Rapper Bad Bunny to play Spider-Man character El Muerto in standalone movie
332.article_body: Puerto Rican rapper Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio, professionally known as Bad Bunny, has been roped in to essay the role of Marvel hero El Muerto in a standalone film. El Muerto, known as Juan-Carlos Estrada Sanchez in the comics, is a super-powered wrestler who fought Spider-Man in a charity wrestling match. The film will reportedly release on January 12, 2024.

333.title: UK drops tariffs on all goods from Ukraine to help its economy
333.article_body: Following a direct request from Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, the UK has dropped tariffs on goods coming from Ukraine. The move would provide "much-needed economic support" to Ukraine, UK government said. "The UK will continue to do everything in its power to support Ukraine's fight against [Vladimir] Putin's brutal...invasion," UK International Trade Secretary Anne-Marie Trevelyan said.

334.title: Police to question Tejasvi Surya over attack on Kejriwal's house
334.article_body: Delhi Police has asked BJP MP Tejasvi Surya to join the investigation into the recent attack on CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence. The investigating officer has called Surya, who is also Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) chief, for questioning on April 28 at Civil Lines police station, according to police. Surya has reportedly agreed to join the probe.

335.title: Alphonso mango supply crosses 70,000 boxes at Mumbai's Vashi market
335.article_body: The Agricultural Produce Market Committee (APMC) received highest lot of Alphonso mangoes of over 72,000 boxes on Monday. Market will continue to receive good quantity of mangoes till May 15, traders at APMC said. Farmers are sending mangoes which are almost ready without checking supply and demand status, an APMC official said. They want to recover their investment, he added.

336.title: 32 more test COVID-19 positive at IIT Madras campus; tally rises to 111
336.article_body: At least 32 more persons tested COVID-19 positive at IIT Madras campus in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases to 111. "During inspection, we found that people from 13 districts and one from abroad had stayed at a particular hostel. Through that one person, the virus spread to other departments and hostels," state Health Secretary said.

337.title: Pics from 66-year-old ex-India cricketer Arun Lal's haldi ceremony surface
337.article_body: Pictures from 66-year-old former India cricketer Arun Lal's haldi ceremony have surfaced online. Arun Lal will get married to 38-year-old Bul Bul Saha in Kolkata on May 2. Bul Bul is a school teacher by profession. Arun Lal is currently the head coach of Bengal cricket team. The duo had reportedly got engaged last month.

338.title: Musk likes a cartoon about him on 'setting the blue bird free'
338.article_body: Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, liked a cartoon on Twitter about the acquisition. "Elon Musk has finally set the blue bird free," the tweet accompanying the cartoon read. "Free speech is the bedrock of a functioning democracy, and Twitter is the digital town square where matters vital to the future of humanity are debated," Musk has said.

339.title: 80-year-old beggar woman donates ₹1 lakh to temple in Karnataka
339.article_body: An 80-year-old woman who has been begging near temples during festivals for the last 18 years after her husband passed away, donated ₹1 lakh to Sri Kshethra Rajarajeshwari Temple in Karnataka. Ashwathamma from Udupi got the money by collecting alms for about a month in front of the same temple. She has donated money to other temples as well.

340.title: Will Smith is a sweetheart; sometimes things happen: AR Rahman on slap incident
340.article_body: AR Rahman reacted to Will Smith's Oscar slap incident on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. The composer-singer was shown a picture of himself with Will Smith. While the photo was old, a few comments on it were made post the Oscar incident. Sharing his experience of meeting Will Smith, AR Rahman said, "He is a sweetheart," adding, "Sometimes such things happen."

341.title: Adani in advanced talks to buy Holcim's majority stake in Ambuja: Report
341.article_body: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group is in advanced talks to acquire Holcim Ltd's businesses in India, Bloomberg reported. Adani could sign a deal to buy a controlling stake in Ambuja Cements from Holcim in the coming days, Bloomberg added. Holcim, the world's largest cement maker, currently owns 63.1% stake in Ambuja, which has a market value of about $10 billion.

342.title: Ambati Rayudu's hand was bruising: Fleming on Rayudu's 78(39)
342.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming has revealed that Ambati Rayudu got injured while fielding in the first innings against PBKS and was in pain during his 78-run innings. "Rayudu's hand was bruising...It was the same hand that was broken sometime back, so it's still pretty tender and a knock like that can obviously cause some damage," added Fleming.

343.title: Russia fines Meta for not deleting 'LGBT propaganda' post: Report
343.article_body: A Russian court has fined Meta four million roubles ($54,030) for failing to delete posts containing "LGBT propaganda", news agency Interfax reported. As per Russian law, "promotion of non-traditional sexual relations to minors" is prohibited. Last month, Russian communications regulator said it drew up two administrative cases against Google for failing to remove banned content from YouTube.

344.title: PMC warns against submission of incorrect docs for COVID-19 claims
344.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has asked people to submit correct documents for claiming COVID-19 compensation as they would otherwise face legal action, a senior health officer at the civic body said. The officer added that the PMC has received 16,000 claims, of which 2,000 have been cleared. The Centre has announced a ₹50,000 compensation to kin of each COVID-19 victim.

345.title: Hope central leaders find way so that I continue to remain in Cong: Hardik Patel
345.article_body: Gujarat Congress Working President Hardik Patel on Tuesday said he is currently with the party and "hoped" that the central leaders find a way so that he continues to remain in the Congress. "I am in Congress currently...There are others who want Hardik to leave Congress. They want to break my morale," Patel tweeted.

346.title: Electricity crisis in UP likely to worsen due to coal shortage: Govt officials
346.article_body: The electricity crisis in Uttar Pradesh is likely to worsen as the coal stock backup for thermal power plants was in the "critical" and "super-critical" range as of April 22, months ahead of monsoon, state energy department officials said. Officials attributed the coal shortage to lesser supply from coal companies due to shortage of wagons for ferrying coal to plants.

347.title: Vivek joins Shilpa, Sidharth in Rohit Shetty's cop series Indian Police Force
347.article_body: Actor Vivek Oberoi has joined actors Shilpa Shetty and Sidharth Malhotra in the Rohit Shetty's cop series 'Indian Police Force'. Taking to Twitter, Vivek made an official announcement that he has joined hands with Rohit in his cop universe. Sharing a picture of himself as a police officer, Vivek wrote, "Thank you...Rohit Shetty for trusting me with this amazing role!"

348.title: Musk hasn't backed projects that aren't game-changers: Ukraine Vice PM
348.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal saying, "Over the past decades, Elon Musk has not invested in projects that are not the game-changers of the industry." He added that he is sure an "unexpected turn in the development of social media" is on its way.

349.title: Temple, mosque in UP's Jhansi remove loudspeakers to promote harmony
349.article_body: A temple and mosque in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi, which are located near each other, have taken down their loudspeakers to promote communal harmony. "The bhajans (prayers) are being recited regularly but without loudspeakers," the temple's priest said. The mosque's imam said, "We have been living in harmony and this (loudspeakers) cannot be allowed to come in the way."
