350.title: Upset over being sacked, man sets woman ablaze in Pune; dies himself
350.article_body: A 35-year-old man, Milind Nathsagar, who set a 32-year old woman, Bala Janind, on fire after allegedly being sacked by her from her tailoring shop, died of burn injuries himself in Pune. While the woman sustained 90 per cent burn injuries in the incident, another person who tried to intervene has sustained 35 per cent burn injuries.

351.title: He's the best death bowler in IPL 2022: Rabada on Arshdeep Singh
351.article_body: PBKS pacer Kagiso Rabada has praised his teammate pacer Arshdeep Singh, stating that the 23-year-old is the "best death bowler" in the ongoing tournament. "Arshdeep has got a lot of talent, drive and ambition...So, nice to have him around. I know I'm going to bowl at the death...[but] he has been leading the way in that discipline," stated Rabada.

352.title: I am a child of war, know what it's like to lose close people: Djokovic
352.article_body: Discussing the sanctions imposed on Russian and Belarusian athletes, Novak Djokovic said, "I grew up with sanctions. I know how it feels when the world sees you differently because a bad image has been created." "I am a child of war...[and] know what it is like to lose close people. I will be against it forever," added Djokovic.

353.title: Over 45 cr people lost hope of getting job due to PM's 'masterstrokes': Rahul
353.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday alleged that over 45 crore people have lost hope of getting a job due to PM Modi's 'masterstrokes'. "New India's new slogan - har ghar berozegaari, ghar ghar berozegaari (there is unemployment in every household)," he tweeted. Rahul also cited a news report that claimed 2.1 crore jobs were lost in last five years.

354.title: PMPML to start electric bus service at Pune's Sinhagad Fort from May 1
354.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has decided to start its electric bus service at Sinhagad Fort ghat section from May 1. "There is a charging point at the bottom of the fort. Parking space is also available for buses. People will be able to take the bus from here to the fort," the PMPML chairman said.

355.title: Indian healthcare sector becoming affordable, accessible for everyone: Mandaviya
355.article_body: The Indian healthcare sector is becoming affordable and accessible for everyone, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on Monday at the inauguration of the 7th edition of the International Conference on Pharma and Medical Devices sector. "Government has been working relentlessly to increase the number of doctors, medical institutions and health infrastructure," Mandaviya added.

356.title: 'Taarak Mehta...' team apologises over wrong year of Lata Mangeshkar's song
356.article_body: After the 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' team went on to air an incorrect fact about Lata Mangeshkar's 'Aye Mere Watan Ke Logo', it apologised in a post on Twitter. "We inadvertently mentioned 1965 as the year of release of the song. However, we would like to correct ourselves. The song was released on 26th Jan, 1963," it said.

357.title: Told the boys if one single 'F**k you comes your way, give them 3 back': Ravi Shastri
357.article_body: Talking about becoming Team India's director in 2014, Ravi Shastri said that he wanted the team to be aggressive and ruthless. "It was about attitude, especially when playing against Australians," he added. Shastri stated, "I told the boys if one single 'F**k you’ comes your way, give them three back: two in our language and one in theirs."

358.title: Cristiano Ronaldo leaving Man Utd didn't impact the club: Gary Neville
358.article_body: Ex-Manchester United player Gary Neville said Cristiano Ronaldo's transfer from Manchester United to Real Madrid in 2009 "did not" have an impact on the club, as there was no speculation. "Everyone knew what was happening," added Neville. Ronaldo joined Real Madrid for £80 million scoring 451 goals in 438 matches. Ronaldo scored 118 goals for United from 2003 to 2009.

359.title: Unique incident in India's history: Kejriwal on Delhi-Punjab knowledge agreement
359.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal signed a Knowledge Sharing Agreement with the Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government and said, "It is a unique incident in the history of India." "Governments are signing an agreement to share knowledge...our goal is to learn from each other and move forward. It's a big development," he said soon after signing the agreement.

360.title: 1st all-private astronaut crew to ISS returns after 15 days in orbit
360.article_body: The first all-private astronaut team ever to fly aboard the ISS has successfully landed back on Earth. The crew spent around 15 days in orbit, conducting a variety of science experiments and technology demonstrations. It was led by former NASA astronaut Michael López-Alegría and included Canada's Mark Pathy, US-based Larry Connor, and former Israeli Air Force pilot Eytan Stibbe.

361.title: Universities not a place for distributing degrees alone: UP CM
361.article_body: Universities are not a place for distributing degrees alone and it is unfortunate that universities of UP have been "victims" of politics for decades, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said. "The quality of education was not taken care of. Now that won’t happen. The campaign to free the education department from the mafia will continue with more rigidity," CM Yogi added.

362.title: Covaxin gets approval for restricted emergency use in children aged 6-12 years
362.article_body: Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) has granted restricted emergency use authorisation to Bharat Biotech's Covaxin for children between the age of 6-12 years. The company has been asked to submit safety data, including that on adverse events, with due analysis every 15 days for the first two months and monthly thereafter for five months.

363.title: Ukraine city Kreminna falls to Russia: UK
363.article_body: The British Defense Ministry said the town of Kreminna in Ukraine's eastern Luhansk region has reportedly fallen to Russian forces. Street-to-street fighting had been going on for days in the city in the Luhansk region, making civilian evacuations there impossible. The ministry also said Russian forces are likely attempting to encircle heavily fortified Ukrainian positions in the east of Ukraine.

364.title: Delhi police arrests 3 men for promoting enmity between religious groups
364.article_body: The Delhi police arrested three men in two separate cases for promoting enmity between religious groups and creating disharmony in Khajuri Khas and Seelampur areas. "These boys were uttering threatening words...They also tried to manhandle the complainant...(We) found that the men were trying to disturb the peace in the area," said DCP (Northeast) Sanjay Kumar Sain.

365.title: Everton players have been cheating their manager, the fans: Carragher
365.article_body: Reacting to Everton's 0-2 defeat against Liverpool in the Premier League, ex-Liverpool player Jamie Carragher said, "Everton players have been cheating their manager Frank Lampard and their fans this season." "Everton need to look at themselves because now they are in the bottom three [on the points table], and they have to start fighting for their lives," added Carragher.

366.title: Drunk Thane man slaps policeman trying to resolve fight between him and his wife
366.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested after he, in a drunken state, allegedly slapped a police constable who tried to resolve a fight between him and his wife in Thane. The accused allegedly verbally abused police personnel and tried to attack other constables when he was taken to the police station. Police claimed there were regular complaints from the accused's wife.

367.title: 27-yr-old man dies due to electrocution in Bengaluru, probe underway
367.article_body: A 27-year-old man died due to an electric shock after coming in contact with a broken electric wire near Sanjaynagar in Bengaluru. According to police, the deceased, identified as Kishore, came in contact with the electric wire in a park on Monday night. The police said they have registered a case into the matter.

368.title: Was heartbroken when I got to know about match-fixing in cricket: Taapsee
368.article_body: Recalling her obsession with cricket, actress Taapsee Pannu said, "I was an ardent cricket fan. I used to sit and pray between matches for India to win. My heartbeat rate depended on the way a match was going." "When I got to know about match-fixing that little girl who was obsessed with cricket was heartbroken," she added.

369.title: Humans could suffer 560 catastrophes every year by 2030: UN
369.article_body: If current trends continue the world will go from around 400 disasters per year in 2015 to an onslaught of about 560 catastrophes a year by 2030, according to a UN report. The number of extreme heat waves in 2030 will be three times what it was in 2001 and there will be 30% more droughts, the report predicted.

370.title: I was a meme queen in middle school, kids were pretty mean: Iga Świątek
370.article_body: Reacting to memes made on her on social media, world number one tennis player Iga Świątek said, "Honestly, I was...a 'meme queen' [in]...middle school. But that was pretty mean from the other kids." "Maybe that's another thing I was born to do," added Świątek. "I don't know if I should be happy or sad about that," stated Świątek.

371.title: BJP tries to mislead people when governance fails: KTR
371.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday said the BJP uses a “diversionary tactic” of raising issues such as Hanuman Chalisa and Hijab in different states in an attempt to “mislead people when governance fails". "When governance fails, the party in power, especially the BJP, tries to mislead people of the country," Rao added.

372.title: Sri Lanka in talks with China to refinance debt amid crisis
372.article_body: Amid the ongoing economic crisis, the Sri Lankan government has held discussions with China seeking to refinance its debt. "China has indicated their stance is that because they have lent to many countries around the world...they have suggested that they will refinance the debt," said a Sri Lankan minister. The discussions were at an early stage, he added.

373.title: Inmates try smoking tea leaves, rolling up dried grass: Burail Officer
373.article_body: A jail officer said that they have recovered half-burnt rolled papers from barracks prisoners who had a habit of smoking before they were arrested. "Sale of tobacco products...like beedi and cigarettes...has been banned inside the jail since 2014...Some try smoking with tea leaves. Others who do not get tea leaves have tried rolling up dry grass," the officer said.

374.title: Telangana couple kills 23-year-old son addicted to liquor, drugs
374.article_body: A couple in Telangana strangled their 23-year-old son as they were unable to bear the daily suffering at the hands of their liquor and drug addict son. The incident took place in Dharmaram village of Konaraopet Mandal, about 160 km from Hyderabad. The son, Nikhil, used to quarrel with them and resort to violence every day, the police said.

375.title: Hyd police officer gives food to beggar family; video surfaces
375.article_body: Hyderabad's SR Nagar Station House Officer (SHO) on Monday took to Twitter to share a video of a police officer distributing food to a beggar family at a bus stop. The video shows the police officer putting food on plates in front of a woman. A Twitter user reacted to this, saying, "Salute to Telangana police and SR Nagar SHO."

376.title: Afghanistan writes to UNSC over Pak airstrikes which killed 40
376.article_body: The Afghanistan government has written to the UNSC complaining against alleged airstrikes carried out by Pakistan, in which 40 people were said to be killed. In a letter to the UNSC President, Afghanistan Chargé d'affaires called the attack "a flagrant breach of international laws, including humanitarian laws, the principles of UN Charter, the UNGA and UNSC resolutions".

377.title: CSK are putting a lot of pressure on Mitchell Santner: Imran Tahir
377.article_body: Ex-CSK spinner Imran Tahir said CSK are putting a "lot of pressure" on the franchise's all-rounder Mitchell Santner, by asking him to bat at the number three position. "CSK are asking too much from a guy who has always batted down the order," added Tahir. Santner scored nine runs off 15 balls in CSK's defeat against PBKS.

378.title: If there's one team that has complete bowling in IPL 2022, it's RR: Parthiv
378.article_body: Former India cricketer Parthiv Patel has said that RR are the only team in IPL 2022 who have a "complete" bowling attack. "Prasidh Krishna is a different bowler while Obed McCoy is a left-armer. Ashwin and Chahal are a good spin pair. There is Trent Boult as well...they have ticked all the boxes," added Parthiv.

379.title: Meta appeals UK order to sell GIF-sharing platform GIPHY
379.article_body: Facebook-owner Meta has started its appeal against UK's Competition and Markets Authority's ruling that it must sell GIF-sharing platform GIPHY. It argued that its rival Snap offered far less to buy the platform which undermined the rationale used to block the deal. The CMA said it will defend its decision "vigorously". Meta acquired GIPHY in 2020 for $400 million.

380.title: AAP protests outside Guj Vidhan Sabha over school fee hike; 8 held
380.article_body: Eight AAP members, including state general secretary Manoj Sorathiya, were detained outside Gujarat Vidhan Sabha in Gandhinagar during a protest over a fee hike in private schools on Monday. The party also shared pictures and videos of the incident online. "State government is misusing police and administration to illegally pick up AAP workers...protesting for the sake of parents," Sorathiya said.

381.title: Radhika wraps up 'Vikram Vedha' shoot, says 'Felt nice to get back on set'
381.article_body: Radhika Apte has wrapped up the shoot of 'Vikram Vedha', an upcoming Hindi film which is a remake of the Tamil neo-noir action-thriller film of the same name. The actress, while sharing her experience, said, "I had a lovely time...It felt nice to get back on...set." The film will feature Hrithik Roshan as Vedha and Saif Ali Khan as Vikram.

382.title: Sanjay Leela Bhansali is a magician, he only thinks about his movie: Alia
382.article_body: Bhansali Productions, the production house behind 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', on Monday shared a behind-the-scenes clip from the film's set wherein Alia Bhatt shared her experience of working with the director Sanjay Leela Bhansali. The actress called him a magician and said, "He only eats, breathes, drinks, thinks about his movie and that's automatically what happens on his set when you're around."

383.title: Delhi's max temperature may touch 42°C today; heatwave predicted from April 28-30
383.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi is likely to reach 42°C on Tuesday, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Strong winds are also predicted for the day after parts of Delhi and the National Capital Region (NCR) witnessed strong winds on Monday night. The city is likely to face heatwave conditions from April 28 to 30 and May 2.

384.title: NCPCR seeks report after 5 kids injured in crude bomb blast in WB
384.article_body: National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has taken cognisance of an incident in West Bengal's Malda, wherein five children were injured after some crude bombs, which they mistook for balls, exploded. The child rights body has asked the state DGP and Chief Secretary to submit a report on the matter within 10 days and order a probe.

385.title: NATO, in essence, is engaged in a war with us: Russia
385.article_body: After deliveries of western weapons to Ukraine, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said, "NATO, in essence, is engaged in a war with Russia through a proxy and is arming that proxy." "These weapons will be a legitimate target for Russia's military acting within the context of the special operation," he told state television in an interview.

386.title: Harbhajan Singh reveals his all-time IPL XI, names MS Dhoni as captain
386.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has named his all-time IPL XI, which includes five Indians and six foreigners. Harbhajan included MS Dhoni in the XI as wicketkeeper and captain. He named Chris Gayle and Rohit Sharma as openers. Other players include Virat Kohli, Shane Watson, AB de Villiers, Ravindra Jadeja, Kieron Pollard, Sunil Narine, Lasith Malinga and Jasprit Bumrah.

387.title: I was like '7 bloody calls? What's happened here?': Shastri on BCCI hiring him in 2014
387.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri revealed his job "instantly" changed when BCCI hired him as Team India director without any warning in 2014. "I was commentating...I came off air to find 6-7 missed calls. [I was like] 'Seven bloody calls? What's happened here?'" he said. "[The BCCI] just said: 'We want you to take over...starting tomorrow...at any cost'," Shastri stated.

388.title: Did China just gain a bit of leverage over town square: Bezos on Musk's Twitter takeover
388.article_body: Sharing a tweet by a journalist pointing out connections between Tesla and the Chinese government following Elon Musk's deal to buy Twitter, Jeff Bezos tweeted, "Did the Chinese government just gain a bit of leverage over the town square?" He added, "My own answer...is probably not. The more likely outcome...is complexity in China for Tesla, rather than censorship at Twitter."

389.title: Kendriya Vidyalaya revises admission guidelines, removes MP quota
389.article_body: The Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan (KVS) issued revised admission guidelines for academic year 2022-2023 and discontinued the MPs' discretionary quota in recommending admission of students to Kendriya Vidyalaya. The new guidelines also stated that children orphaned due to COVID-19 pandemic will be considered for admission over and above the class strength under PM CARES for Children Scheme.

390.title: Russia is targeting railways to cut arms supply routes: Ukraine
390.article_body: Ukraine's military command has accused Russia of attacking the nation's railway infrastructure in order to disrupt supply lines for military equipment from foreign countries. It comes after Ukrainian Railways reported that five train stations in central and western Ukraine had been hit by Russian missile strikes. Many trains reportedly have been forced to alter routes and schedules after attacks.

391.title: Hackers steal NFTs worth $3 mn in Bored Ape club's Instagram hack
391.article_body: Hackers have stolen NFTs worth $3 million from owners after hacking into the Instagram account belonging to the Bored Ape Yacht Club collection. They uploaded a post that linked to a cloned version of BAYC's website and included a free crypto tokens offer. Hacked owners together lost four Bored Apes, six Mutant Apes and three Bored Ape Kennel Club NFTs.

392.title: PM Modi gives equal respect to all CMs of India: Tripura CM
392.article_body: Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb said that PM Narendra Modi gives equal respect to all CMs. "PM Modi gives equal importance to the CM of Tripura and CM of Uttar Pradesh, there is no disparity," Deb said. "PM specially sanctioned ₹7 crore for constructing a high-tech building for the old age homes. This is the vision of PM," he said.

393.title: If anyone wants to chant Hanuman Chalisa do it in homes, temples: Raut
393.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said if anyone wants to chant Hanuman Chalisa then they can do it in their homes or temples. "Devendra Fadnavis (BJP leader) is misleading people. No one is punished for chanting Hanuman Chalisa," Raut added. "Trying to get inside someone else's home and destroy peace to chant Hanuman Chalisa is wrong," Raut stated.

394.title: Gang of inter-state burglars held in Bengaluru, gold worth ₹1.1 cr seized
394.article_body: Bengaluru Police have busted a gang of three inter-state burglars and seized gold jewellery worth ₹1.1 crore. According to the police, the men were arrested following a spate of house burglaries reported in Sanjaynagar over the past month. All cases had a similar modus operandi wherein the window grilles were cut open using an electric machine, police said.

395.title: Drunk man hits home guard with SUV, arrested by Gurugram police
395.article_body: The Gurugram Police have arrested a man for allegedly hitting a home guard with his SUV in an inebriated condition. Police said that the man was produced before a court on Monday which sent him to judicial custody. Police added that incident happened on intervening night of April 23 and 24 when the car was intercepted but did not stop.

396.title: Mumbai, Thane witness blackouts after major glitch at Padgha distribution centre
396.article_body: A major glitch at the Padgha electricity distribution centre in Maharashtra's Thane led to blackouts in many areas in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Panvel, Palghar, Vasai Virar and others on Tuesday morning. There was a burst in the transmission centre which led to power failure in many areas of Mumbai Metropolitan Region, a Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited official said.

397.title: Ensure no hate speeches are made at religious event tomorrow: SC to U'khand govt
397.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday told the Uttarakhand government to ensure no hate speeches are made at the Dharma Sansad event scheduled in Roorkee on Wednesday. "If hate speech is not stopped, the [Uttarakhand] Chief Secretary will be held responsible," the SC added. Hate speeches were allegedly delivered at a religious gathering in Haridwar in December last year.

398.title: 115 more complain of diarrhoea after consuming contaminated water in Punjab
398.article_body: A day after 15 people fell ill after consuming contaminated water in Gazipur village of Punjab's Zirakpur, 115 more cases of diarrhoea were reported from the area. The Health Department reached the village and organised a medical camp. Officials said a team conducted door-to-door surveys and samples were also collected. The Zirakpur civic body supplied water tankers to the village.

399.title: 3 foreign nationals held for cheating prospective kidney donors in B'luru
399.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested three foreign nationals, including two people from Nigeria and one from Ghana, for allegedly cheating prospective kidney donors. The accused created fake websites of various city hospitals and lured kidney donors for transplants with advertisements offering up to ₹4 crore, police said. They were arrested following a complaint by medical director of Sagar Hospitals.

400.title: Punjab DGP launches web portal to report cyber crimes
400.article_body: Punjab DGP VK Bhawra launched a one interface multifunctional web portal for the citizens to immediately report all kinds of cyber crimes and frauds. The web portal, cybercrime.punjabpolice.gov.in, was launched on Monday. Besides lodging all kinds of cyber crimes and cyber financial frauds, the user can also track the status of their complaint using this portal, Bhawra said.

401.title: First genome sequencing lab in western UP to come up in Greater Noida
401.article_body: The first genome sequencing laboratory in western UP will likely begin its operation by May 10 at the Government Institute of Medical Sciences (GIMS) in Kasna, Greater Noida. "We will initially be able to test about 50 samples on a daily basis," GIMS director said. As of now, samples are sent to Delhi or Lucknow for genome sequencing.

402.title: Ex-eBay exec pleads guilty to harassing US couple critical of eBay
402.article_body: James Baugh, eBay's former senior director of safety and security, has pleaded guilty to harassing a US couple, who ran a website critical of eBay, by arranging anonymous messages on Twitter and sending home deliveries that included a bloody pig mask and live insects. Baugh has pleaded guilty to nine counts including conspiracy, stalking through interstate travel and witness tampering.

403.title: 2 Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists held with ammunition in J&K's Baramulla
403.article_body: Two terrorists associated with Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) were arrested with arms and ammunition in J&K's Baramulla, the Indian Army said on Tuesday. They were apprehended in a joint operation led by Baramulla Police, 29 Rashtriya Rifles and Central Reserve Police Force. "The army...recovered two Chinese pistols, two pistol magazines, ten ammunition pistols and two Chinese grenades," the army said.
